segment.source: Learn how to access and update the list of supported phrases (PhraseList elements) in a Voice Command Definition (VCD) file using the speech recognition result at run time.
segment.target: Learn how to access and update the list of supported phrases (PhraseList elements) in a Voice Command Definition (VCD) file using the speech recognition result at run time.

segment.target: Dynamically modify VCD phrase lists

segment.source: Windows.ApplicationModel.VoiceCommands
segment.target: Windows.ApplicationModel.VoiceCommands

segment.source: VCD elements and attributes v1.2
segment.target: VCD elements and attributes v1.2

segment.source: Learn how to access and update the list of supported phrases (PhraseList elements) in a Voice Command Definition (VCD) file using the speech recognition result at run time.
segment.target: Learn how to access and update the list of supported phrases (PhraseList elements) in a Voice Command Definition (VCD) file using the speech recognition result at run time.

segment.source: Dynamically modifying a phrase list at run time can be useful if the voice command is specific to a task involving some kind of user-defined favorites or transient app data.
segment.target: Dynamically modifying a phrase list at run time can be useful if the voice command is specific to a task involving some kind of user-defined favorites or transient app data.

segment.source: For example, let's say you have a travel app where users can enter destinations, and you want users to be able to start the app by saying the app name followed by "Show trip to destination".
segment.target: For example, let's say you have a travel app where users can enter destinations, and you want users to be able to start the app by saying the app name followed by "Show trip to destination".

segment.source: You don't need to create a separate ListenFor element for each possible destination.
segment.target: You don't need to create a separate ListenFor element for each possible destination.

segment.source: Instead, you can dynamically populate PhraseList at run time with the destinations created by the user.
segment.target: Instead, you can dynamically populate PhraseList at run time with the destinations created by the user.

segment.source: In the ListenFor element itself, you could specify something like: , where "destination" is the value of the Label attribute for the PhraseList.
segment.target: In the ListenFor element itself, you could specify something like: , where "destination" is the value of the Label attribute for the PhraseList.

segment.source: For more info about PhraseList and other VCD elements, see the VCD elements and attributes v1.2 reference.
segment.target: For more info about PhraseList and other VCD elements, see the VCD elements and attributes v1.2 reference.

segment.source: Prerequisites:
segment.target: Prerequisites:

segment.source: This topic builds on Launch a foreground app with voice commands in Cortana.
segment.target: This topic builds on Launch a foreground app with voice commands in Cortana.

segment.source: We continue here to demonstrate features with a trip planning and management app named Adventure Works.
segment.target: We continue here to demonstrate features with a trip planning and management app named Adventure Works.

segment.source: If you're new to developing Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps, have a look through these topics to get familiar with the technologies discussed here.
segment.target: If you're new to developing Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps, have a look through these topics to get familiar with the technologies discussed here.

segment.source: Create your first app
segment.target: Create your first app

segment.target: Learn about events with Events and routed events overview

segment.source: User experience guidelines:
segment.target: User experience guidelines:

segment.source: See Cortana design guidelines for info about how to integrate your app with Cortana and Speech design guidelines for helpful tips on designing a useful and engaging speech-enabled app.
segment.target: See Cortana design guidelines for info about how to integrate your app with Cortana and Speech design guidelines for helpful tips on designing a useful and engaging speech-enabled app.

segment.source: Identify the command
segment.target: Identify the command

segment.source: To update a PhraseList element in the VCD file, get the CommandSet element that contains the phrase list.
segment.target: To update a PhraseList element in the VCD file, get the CommandSet element that contains the phrase list.

segment.source: Use the Name attribute of that CommandSet element (Name must be unique in the VCD file) as a key to access the VoiceCommandManager.InstalledCommandSets property and get the VoiceCommandSet reference.
segment.target: Use the Name attribute of that CommandSet element (Name must be unique in the VCD file) as a key to access the VoiceCommandManager.InstalledCommandSets property and get the VoiceCommandSet reference.

segment.source: Replace the phrase list
segment.target: Replace the phrase list

segment.source: After you've identified the command set, get a reference to the phrase list that you want to modify and call the SetPhraseListAsync method; use the Label attribute of the PhraseList element and an array of strings as the new content of the phrase list.
segment.target: After you've identified the command set, get a reference to the phrase list that you want to modify and call the SetPhraseListAsync method; use the Label attribute of the PhraseList element and an array of strings as the new content of the phrase list.

segment.source: Note If you modify a phrase list, the entire phrase list is replaced.
segment.target: Note If you modify a phrase list, the entire phrase list is replaced.

segment.source: If you want to insert new items into a phrase list, you must specify both the existing items and the new items in the call to SetPhraseListAsync.
segment.target: If you want to insert new items into a phrase list, you must specify both the existing items and the new items in the call to SetPhraseListAsync.

segment.source: Here, the VCD file defines a Command"showTripToDestination" with a PhraseList that defines three options for selecting a destination in our Adventure Works travel app.
segment.target: Here, the VCD file defines a Command"showTripToDestination" with a PhraseList that defines three options for selecting a destination in our Adventure Works travel app.

segment.source: As the user saves and deletes destinations in the app, the app updates the options in the PhraseList.
segment.target: As the user saves and deletes destinations in the app, the app updates the options in the PhraseList.

segment.source: Here's how to update the PhraseList shown in the previous example with an additional destination to Phoenix.
segment.target: Here's how to update the PhraseList shown in the previous example with an additional destination to Phoenix.

segment.source: Remarks
segment.target: Remarks

segment.source: Using a PhraseList to constrain the recognition is appropriate for a relatively small set or words.
segment.target: Using a PhraseList to constrain the recognition is appropriate for a relatively small set or words.

segment.source: When the set of words is too large (hundreds of words, for example), or shouldn’t be constrained at all, use the PhraseTopic element and a Subject element to refine the relevance of speech-recognition results to improve scalability.
segment.target: When the set of words is too large (hundreds of words, for example), or shouldn’t be constrained at all, use the PhraseTopic element and a Subject element to refine the relevance of speech-recognition results to improve scalability.

segment.source: In our example, we have a PhraseTopic with a Scenario of "Search", further refined by a Subject of "City\\State".
segment.target: In our example, we have a PhraseTopic with a Scenario of "Search", further refined by a Subject of "City\\State".
